data.name: Yonkers Saison (Baby Tvert)
data.description: Refreshingly Hoppy, Fruity. Spicy Farmhouse Ale

style.name: French & Belgian-Style Saison
style.description: Beers in this category are golden to deep amber in color. There may be quite a variety of characters within this style. Generally: They are light to medium in body. Malt aroma is low to medium-low. Esters are medium to high in  aroma, while, complex alcohols, herbs, spices, low Brettanomyces character and even clove and smoke-like phenolics may or may not be evident in the overall balanced beer. Hop aroma and flavor may be at low to medium levels. Malt flavor is low but provides foundation for the overall balance. Hop bitterness is moderate to moderately assertive. Herb and/or spice flavors, including black pepper-like notes, may or may not be evident. Fruitiness from fermentation is generally in character. A balanced small amount of sour or acidic flavors is acceptable when in balance with other components. Earthy, cellar-like, musty aromas are okay. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Chill or slight yeast haze is okay. Often bottle conditioned with some yeast character and high carbonation. French & Belgian-Style Saison may have Brettanomyces characters that are slightly acidity, fruity, horsey, goaty and/or leather-like.

breweries.name: Yonkers Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
The Yonkers Brewing Co. is a family of beer lovers and business minded people who have created a great beer for a great city. We are committed to creating quality hand-crafted brew with character. We are dedicated to bringing styles to market that will thrill the senses - color, aroma, texture, flavor and even sound (yes, our beer talks to us). 

Why Yonkers?

Yonkers is experiencing a rebirth; it is experiencing a renaissance of architecture, business, communities - a renaissance of renewal. The city has always been a hub of culture and innovation – from Otis Elevator to Bakelite to Ella Fitzgerld – a city rich in arts, entertainment, cuisine and libations. Yonkers is a hub to New York City and to the Hudson Valley. It offers top-notch shopping such a Ridge Hill, amazing gardens like Untemeyer Park, and not to mention some amazing restaurants like Zuppa, X20, Pinch at Empire City, Rory Dolan’s and more. 

With a growing beer culture, an array of top notch restaurants and a rich history, Yonkers has all the components of a great beer city. Co-Founders John Rubbo and Nick Califano have planted the roots of the brewery here and are excited to be part of a long list of exciting things happening.

breweries.description: TRiNiTY BREWiNG Company is a Public Ale and Lager House. Inspired by Belgian and English tap houses, our pub focuses on three major concepts: Artisanal Beer, Slow Food, and Conscious People. Cheers!

breweries.name: Brewery Vivant
breweries.description:
Brewery Vivant is the realization of years of dreaming and much discussion of what a great brewery can be. What makes our brewery different from the rest is the way we approach our craft and operate our business. The core of Brewery Vivant can be found at the crossroads of three passions:

1. Our love of the tradition and artistic approach of the Belgian & French styles of beers

2. Devotion to using local sources for ingredients and running our business according to the three pillars of sustainability; Environmental Integrity, Social Equity, and Economic Viability

3. Sharing the experience of how beer and food can be paired to uplift the enjoyment of both

data.name: Zarabanda
data.description:
We looked to acclaimed Chef José Andrés to help us create a Spanish take on the farmhouse-style saison.  The addition of lemon verbena, pink peppercorn, sumac, and dried lime infuse the Chef’s distinctive flavors into the brew – an ale purposefully crafted to complement all your culinary endeavors.  Or to be savored all by itself.

Brewed with Dried Lime, Pink Peppercorn, Sumac, Lemon Verbena.

breweries.name: Deschutes Brewery
breweries.description: Founded in 1988, Deschutes Brewery began as a brew pub in downtown Bend, Oregon and is known for such brands as Black Butte Porter, the nation’s number one selling craft porter, and the popular Mirror Pond Pale Ale. In addition to its original Bend pub, this family and employee-owned brewery opened a second pub in Portland’s Pearl District in 2008. The company’s main brewing facility is located on the banks of the Deschutes River and is the nation's 7th largest craft brewery, distributing in 28 states, Washington D.C., and two Canadian provinces. Deschutes Brewery was named one of America’s Best Places to Work in 2013 & 2014 by Outside Magazine.

breweries.name: Wisconsin Brewing Company
breweries.description:
he Wisconsin Brewing Company brewhouse we're building is an exciting mixture of old world, artisan craftsmanship and state-of-the art brewing technology. Built in Hudson, WI, our German-engineered Huppmann Brewhouse will be capable of producing in excess of 100,000 barrels of Wisconsin craft beer annually. The tradition and history behind Huppmann goes back more than 130 years—perfect for true craft beer.

In addition to a great brew house, we have a one-barrel Pilot Brewery on site to develop many of our beers, as well as an event center for parties and other events. The event center also has a gift shop, where you can buy Wisconsin Brewing Company apparel, gift items, and of course, beer.

Put all these pieces together next to a scenic pond with access to bike trails and plenty of beautiful landscape and you can have one heck of a brewery experience.

data.name: Zero Anniversary Ale
data.description: 5 Stones Craft Brewing Company celebrates our excitement and hard work to even get to the starting line of opening a brewery. This ale is similar to a Belgian-style Farmhouse Saison with our unique additions. We use imported Pilsner, Aromatic, Wheat, and Acidulated malts along with local Texas honey and Tettnang hops to give a fruity, spicy, and flowery complexity to this ale. Two Belgian yeast strains contribute aroma, flavor, and a dry finish.

breweries.name: 5 Stones Artisan Brewery
breweries.description: We are a small batch nano-brewery located "down around" San Antone. Our primary focus is limited releases each season brewed with the freshest local ingredients we can get our hands on.

data.name: Zes Zes Zes
data.description: Now this is a saison! This refreshing Belgian-style ale is the combined effort of Three Floyds and De Molen’s fantastic brewer Menno (the real Dutch Hercules). Cheers and drost!

breweries.name: Three Floyds Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Three Floyds Brewing Company LLC was founded in 1996 by brothers Nick and Simon with their father Mike Floyd. The original brewery was built by Nick and Simon in a run down warehouse located in Hammond, Indiana. The first beers brewed by the brothers were designed to be a departure from the fairly bleak craft brewing scene in the region. Nick and Simon brewed intense balanced beers that were and still remain “not normal” by conventional standards.

In November of 2005, after receiving numerous visitors to the brewery over the years, Three Floyds opened its own brewpub at the production facility. What was once office space is now a refuge for the craft beer enthusiast. With all the Three Floyds mainstays, seasonal offerings, special small batch beers and many guest beers it is a mecca for craft beer. The pub also has a full service kitchen providing pub fare of the best quality supported by a 3000 square foot organic herb and vegetable garden.

breweries.name: Crank Arm Brewing Company
breweries.description: Welcome to Crank Arm Brewing! We are a craft brewery with tasting room located in the heart of the warehouse district in downtown Raleigh, North Carolina. Our mission is to provide fresh artisan beer while utilizing green transportation methods.

data.name: ¡Viva la Revolucìon!
data.description: Honoring the original American revolutionary: George Washington! Created to be something a little different than the standard take on a Pale Ale. This farmhouse pale is finished with Mt Hood & Willamette hops, so it’s not a citrus bomb. Thirst quenching and very drinkable!

breweries.name: Frey's Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Frey's Brewing Company is a small, Farmhouse Brewery in Frederick County, Maryland. Frederick County is home to several wineries and craft breweries. A small farmhouse brewery such as ours fits in the area nicely.

We received our Maryland Beer Manufacturer's Class 5 license on February 1st, 2013. We are allowed to sell beer for off-premise consumption directly to customers that have taken a tour of the brewery - but the amount is limited to 288 ounces. We are currently not allowed to do tastings at our facility, nor allow on-premise consumption of alcohol (unless it is part of a scheduled event). As of July 1st, 2013, we can refill growlers - so bring in your clean growler and we'll fill it up!

data.name: √225 Saison
data.description:
Brewed for the 15th anniversary of the brewery - hence the square root of 225 - a bit like a sort of gag for our domestic market not ready to accept all tart beers, I decided to try. Couroussé by those nasty attitudes of American brewers make 22 different seasons in the same brewery, a bit like an excuse for beers nonsensical to 23% alcohol and very far from the Belgian seasons, I embarked on the adventure . Pale malt, aromatic hops, not always the same. And hop beer once brewed to 5% volume in old barrels St Bon-Chien, full of microorganisms on balance, I'm not 276 before the overflowing barrels.

I taste just me and the idea of ​​cutting the old beer with the same but very fresh and bitter. The 225 season √ Was Born. I add "historical" season ahead for the U.S. market and I put it in my suitcase whenever I meet friends who hold bars. Amazing and rapid success, it becomes a sort of gateway into the wonderful world of beers acids, balanced, acidic and bitter at once complex and easily refreshing, moving beautifully bottled on wild yeasts.


Height of destiny, I talk Yvan Brasserie de la Senne, a geek and beer historian who told me that in Belgium at the time were often the old with the new beers, mixed history to get this weird taste acid. 
Accordingly finally redefined the historical season (pronounced by pinching the nose) style, I cook up some variations. This time, allow me to use the first person singular, because when I came to work with my idea of St festival Bon-Chien, I promise you that my team took me for a fool. One more time.

breweries.name: Brasserie des Franches-Montagnes
breweries.description: Brasserie des Franches-Montagnes, also known by the abbreviation BFM is a small artisanal brewery in Jura, Switzerland whose products, including barrel-aged beers, have drawn international acclaim. Founded in 1997 by Jérôme Rebetez, who had formerly been trained as an oenologist, this tiny brewery has rapidly become known for making beers that stretch traditional beer style guidelines and use unorthodox ingredients. BFM's products are made in small batches and hand-packaged at the brewery.
